conclusion: Determine the voltages in the secondary coils based on the appliances connected.
The transformer has a primary coil and two secondary coils.
Appliance 1 requires 6 V and Appliance 2 requires 110 V.
Voltage across secondary coil for Appliance 1 is 6 V.
Voltage across secondary coil for Appliance 2 is 110 V.
Calculate currents in the secondary coils using the power formula P = U * I.
Current in secondary coil for Appliance 1 is approximately 3.33 A.
Current in secondary coil for Appliance 2 is approximately 0.545 A.
Use transformer current relationship: power in primary coil equals sum of powers in secondary coils.
Primary coil voltage U1 is 220 V.
Calculate input current in primary coil using power equation.
Input current in primary coil is approximately 0.364 A.
